abstract: New York State Board of Regents will decide whether to bar teachers from grading their own students' standardized tests, longstanding practice that state officials say creates temptation for educators to cheat in era of high-stakes exams.
snippet: The New York State Board of Regents is seeking to improve test security in an era of high-stakes exams and rising pressures on educators.
lead_paragraph: The New York State Board of Regents is seeking to improve test security in an era of high-stakes exams and rising pressures on educators.

headline.main: Regents to Vote on Change to Cut Risk of Teachers’ Test-Tampering
headline.print_headline: Regents to Vote on Change to Cut Risk of Teachers’ Test-Tampering
headline.seo: New York Regents May Keep Teachers From Grading Own Students
